comments:
I have hit this error twice now when restarting Mylar after the Laptop woke up from suspend-to-disk (I don't know if it has anyting to do with that though). Mylar writes a repository.xml file that contains the xml twice:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><TaskRepositories>...</TaskRepositories><?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><TaskRepositories>...</TaskRepositories>

Running bootstrapped on latest head on Eclipse 3.3M3.

Steffen, I'm not seeing this under windows and figure this is something to do with file io under linux. Could you investigate, ideally building a failing unit test that we can work from? I'll re-assign to you...

I can't reproduce the error in a test case but I may have found a potential race condition in the code:

RepositorySynchronizationManager.GetChangedTaskJob.run()
 -> TasksUiPlugin.getRepositoryManager().setSyncTime()
  ->TaskRepositoryManager.saveRepositories()

(see RepositorySynchronizationManager.java:234)

If guess that if I modify the repository list at the same time by adding or removing a repository I could trigger the file to be repositories file to be opened twice concurrently.

Synchronizing TaskRepositoryManager.saveRepositories() or making sure it is only invoked from the UI thread should fix the problem.
Oh god! Please don't save anything from the UI thread.
Yes that could be it. I've synchronized the save method as you suggest. Lets see what that gives us...
Rob: I assume that you're handling this one?
Steffen, have you had this reoccur?

No, it hasn't happen again. 

Eugene, you may want to open a new report for not doing I/O in the UI thread :).
